caption: Incredible

Wow. It’s hard to write a review for a dining experience that is unlike anything I’ve ever experienced. Opel is a phenomenal host and a master in fusing personal and culinary experience. The entire staff - especially his son Lio - is incredibly hospitable and friendly, always making sure your experience is catered to how you want to feel and what you’d like to taste. It is heaven for any adventurous (or not) eater. Easily the best Thai food I’ve ever had, and also some of the best service you could imagine. If we lived on the island, we’d come here every opportunity available.
Amazing place, chef chats with you and figures out your menu. The chicken satay was great. We just ate too much! Take Cash!

So I love Thai food but after eating at this place I quickly found out that I realy haven't had real Thai food. Not only the food was amazing but every single person working in that resturant was so friendly. The environment is something I have never experienced. If your reading this and your in hawaii do yourself a favor and just go 🚶 thank me later.
Incredible. Chef customizes your menu based on your crew
Best Thai food iv ever had ,thailand included. If your visiting you have to try this place. If the chef orders for you don't freak out dude knows his stuff.

A cozy little spot with unconventional ordering style. The owner, Opal asks everyone at the table their food preferences, spice tolerance and if there's any food allergies. Then the food just comes out! It was a nice way to try different dishes, as I normally stick with Panang Curry and drunken noodles so, it was nice to get out of my own box. Opal, Leo and the female waitress who's name I didn't get were all very attentive, kind and hilarious and most importantly the food was delicious! (Shout out to the kitchen!) My gal pals and I will defs be back and a bit of advice be on time, the entire party must be present for Opal to ask the aforementioned questions and if you're late he will scold you. But the food is worth it! 😂

Best Thai food! One of a kind experience. Opal really went above and beyond. He asked us some questions and then started making our food based on what we told him. All the food came out AMAZING! Even the food catered to the kids. There was a good variety of dishes. We had some leftovers (but not much because we kept eating LOL). $280 for all that food, tip, and some drinks for 10 people was actually inexpensive. Definitely coming back!

Exceptional Thai food and very friendly owner. The home-made lemonade and sangria are excellent as well. The staff even had my 11 year old son constructively reading National Geographic while waiting for dinner instead of playing games on his phone. After the meal my son said it was the best Thai food he has ever had and that he learned some cool new things from the magazine too!
Opal’s is a fantastic restaurant and the owner himself is such a sweet man and amazing chef. Will be back.

If you are open minded to an experience, come here.  My friends and I that came here are not at all Thai connoisseurs. We scanned over the menu while having conversation, and eventually Opal came over and sat down, introduced himself, and joked with us a little. Apparently it is the thing he does, but we didn't actually place an order. He asked what we liked and make accordingly, including a drunken noodle plate with both shrimp and chicken, as I don't like shrimp. The staff was extremely friendly, and we had a fantastic time with fantastic food. The price was absolutely worth it and it seemed reasonable as well, and we'll be going back. I'll be bringing some other friends too. Honestly, we were so busy enjoying ourselves, I didn't remember to get any more pictures.  Please support this local business and have yourself a night out. You won't regret it.
Don't ask questions, just let him take you on a magic journey.

Food were alright and I won’t recommend to any of my friends!!!! First of all, no one had explained the service rules in the restaurant and we called the server few time but no one has stopped, then a dude which was the owner came to us and ask about if we knew any Thai food. Few min later, he came with food said try this you guys will like it. We were like what ?! Was this on house. We didn’t even know the prices and if we ordered the food.. anyway just very confusing. We asked server about the price of the food on our table and she said I will be right back. The owner came and told us we can stop serving food if that isn’t what you guys wanted... we were like we never wanted the food that on our table and he kept saying it’s about the prices. It’s about the prices... so we didn’t know the price still and $75 total for 2 ppl.......  So food weren’t what we want and somewhere got rip off in legal way .... not my type of service I would like and lack of communication  But I will always remember not to come back again.  If you like that kinda service, you welcome to go there. If not, there are many decent restaurants in Hawaii that match your expectations!!
This place had friendly service with welcoming smiles.  Their food is unique and has some surprising fusion twists.
Yeah just come here
Great food and awesome hosting!
If you are courageous and let the owner cook whatever he wants for you, it will be an amazing experience. The food is super tasty and the staff make you feel like it's a special occasion everytime.
Owner has a gift of hospitality. Delicious food. My favorite Thai restaurant in Honolulu !
Great family run spot!! Dont even look at the menu, just tell them what you like and enjoy.

The food was delicious! The owner really grills you on your palate to determine just how to prepare your individual meal to your specific tastes. The only challenges are the restaurant is really warm and the portion, even though I ordered from the house special entree section, was more like appetizer size and left me hungry. (I'm 170lbs) I'm excited to go back but, will try to order something more filling.
Fantastic food! The chef treated me like family and every single dish tasted incredible. My husband and I were very pleased.
Incredible meal front to back! Will definitely be back!

Absolutely amazing!!! Words cannot describe. Food is on point, chefs suggestions amazing and I cannot even pick which is my favorite. What I also LOvE is that they can accommodate allergies so well and you will have piece of mind and experience amazing dishes and not worry! Also prices are so good. Perfect for pick up to go for nice home dinner - of course when can sitting down and enjoying the service is nice :)
Probably one of if not THEE best eating experience on island. Repeat customer many times over and NEVER disappointed!

We ordered chicken panang curry, yellow chicken curry and chicken satay. I’m sorry to say that we unfortunately did not like the taste of anything we ordered. We usually order the same thing from every Thai place we go but this placed missed the mark for us.. :(
Possibly my favorite restaurant in Honolulu. Great food and great service :)

My experience was by far the most exhilarating experience in a restaurant in my entire life. My husband and I are vegetarian, working towards vegan and the owner/chef talked to us to find out a little but more about our pallet. He brought us out numerous Thai dishes both vegetarian and vegan. The food was out of this world good. Him as well as his staff went above and beyond to make us and our children comfortable. My kids adored him. If I could give them more than 5 stars I would! Definitely recommend!
One of the best dining experiences you will ever have.
The food is the best!!!
Absolutely fantastic food and service. Will definitely go back

I lived in Thailand for 3 months and this place hits the mark with a perfect Thai flavor that brings me back, the owner will ask you some questions to understand your pallet and will serve you family style. I guarantee you’ll love this restaurant!

So if adventure and authentic food is what you crave, then this is the place for you. Opal is awesome, he comes out to your table and has a chat with you regarding your likes and dislikes, allergies and where and if you have travelled to Thailand. He is from Bangkok and his wife is from Isan.  After finding out that my date and I are experienced eaters, HAVE been to Thailand, and that we love to try new things, he was off to put in our order.  They must have their liquor license, I have seen some reviews questioning it. We got their signature sangria which is made with a red wine and plenty of fruit. It is so amazing, we had to order two. The best part is eating the wine soaked fruit right from the glass once you have consumed the beverage.  He told us what we ate when we had completed our meal. He is pleasant and eager to share culinary experiences and how he got started from a humble food truck beginning.  Pay attention to the instructions on how to eat. If you aren't instructed...ASK HIM!  The half special cake was a sticky firm fish. So soft with an interesting texture. But oh so delicious. The crunch of the bean sprouts and the fresh cilantro help to round out this dish nicely.  The flavor profile that he and his wife create their culinary masterpieces just overwhelm your mouth with balance between spicy, sweet, savory and acid.  The crispy rice salad with the sausage was just amazing. I loved it. So tasty and with fresh ginger and crunchy cabbage helped offset the fatty crispy rice and Isan style sausage. Like I said, perfect balance.  The Kao Soy soup with chicken was cooked perfectly. The chicken fell off of the bone and the sour soup was the perfect compliment. He actually brought me out this special hot chili condiment to eat with it and it paired perfectly. I was SWEATING!  The sauteed eggplant and crunchy string bean dish cooked to perfection. A great veggie dish. So savory and herbacious with tomatoes and crunchy fried basil!  The total experience, including talking with Opal was Amazing! I decided there that this would be my new favorite restaurant. We spoke of a few dishes that we wanted to try, a fried cat fish fluff and Kra Pao. We also wanted to have a curry with the small eggplant the size of marbles and a special crab dish. He asked that we call him a few days in advance so he could get the ingredients.  Don't get me wrong, if you are stuffy and unable to be adventerous, perhaps this isn't the place for you. If you are fun and willing to be amazed by culinary experiences outside of your comfort zone, then head on down. Let him guide you on a culinary tour of Thailand. Just let go and enjoy what you are served.

Don't eat here if you're in a rush; this is not takeout nor is it "fast food". They CUSTOMIZE your food according to your taste, and that is worth waiting for! The last few times, my wife has simply said "surprise me" (she's super picky mind you) and it's always amazing. The owner is hands-on & a people person - help us keep him in business during this COVID19 craziness!
Thoroughly delightful. Opal is a great person and it reflects in through his food and the welcoming atmosphere he has created for his customers. Looking forward to my next visit.

Best Thai food on the island! Made me have flash backs to our trip to Phuket. Had takeout because we just left the beach but still, Thanks for the amazing Father's Day meal. Next time we will dine in and share a few rounds. The Sangria was great! The people are amazing. Only one recommendation, use Asian pear in the Sangria instead of American pears😁
Best Thai food on the Island.  Great service and Opal is the best!

I stayed in Thailand for a month, and still *this* is my favorite Thai restaurant of them all. Opal asks what you like and chooses what he believes you'll enjoy from his menu. I only wish every restaurant did this

Opal........we miss you, your staff and the food so much! There is not a week that goes by that Sandy and I don't talk about our numerous times there by ourselves and with friends we have brought over the years! We hope you guys are doing well during these crazy times and look forward to seeing you again in a few months. By the way wait til February before you go to Thailand next year! Thanks again for your friendship and hospitality whenever we come!  Sandy & Louis

I now come here weekly since one of my friends introduced me. $25-$30 for dinner after tip but some of the best Thai food you'll ever have. I've never received a menu and have never been disappointed.
Tastes like it was made in Thailand.

(Translated by Google) A Thai restaurant in downtown. I made a reservation at a quite popular store, but it was 20 minutes after the reservation time that I was passed through. You can tell your favorite Thai food, Thai food you have eaten recently and leave it to the owner. Even if you don't understand English, it's okay if you know Thai food names (Gapao, Tom Yum, etc.). When I told them that I had recently eaten Passille, the noodles of the ramen noodles turned into plain noodles of Passille. The owner is friendly and talks quite a bit. The neon heart is cute and looks like an Instagram.  (Original) ダウンタウンにあるお任せタイ料理屋さん。かなり人気店で予約しましたが席に通されたのは予約時間から20分後でした。 好きなタイ料理、最近食べたタイ料理などオーナーに伝えてあとはお任せになります。 英語が分からなくてもタイ料理名(ガパオ、トムヤムなど)を知っていれば大丈夫です。 最近パッシーユを食べたと伝えたら締めのラーメンの麺がパッシーユの平麺になっていました。 オーナーさんが気さくで結構話しかけてきます。 ハートのネオンが可愛くてインスタ映えしそうです。
Truly an experience and definitely worth it!

This is not just a place to eat it's where you experience Thai food. The owner will put a meal together for you customized to what your group can handle and avoid any foods your group can't handle or eat. (In most Asia cultures eating with family is expected and sharing in and with family in this experience) If you wish to just stick to the menu that's up to you. Just be polite about it then. The owner is just inviting you to experience his culture, food and be welcomed to his table. So experience is Aloha here at Opal Thai.

Our meals were exceptionally tasty, appetizingly presentable that we ate every bit of our food! Uncanny that the owner/chef knows our tastebuds to make our meals tailor-made to our liking! Wonderful experience!
Best dinner experience ever!!! Thank you Opal!!!

Unbelievable place! Great hosts, food and relaxing.  No need to look at the menu,  the owner finds out what you like and soon a steady stream of excellent combinations start rolling out.  Extremely good value.  Don't miss it!

We came based on a recommendation from a local and was not disappointed. Even though our 17-month old son was not acting appropriately, the chef insisted we eat there and enjoy the food. I'm so glad he did because it was epic dining. Put simply, go there and eat whatever he gives you. You will enjoy it and remember the experience always. See you next time!

Truly a great dining experience. The chef took the time to speak to us individually and then chose a 7 course meal tailored to our tastes. The wait staff was friendly and attentive and each dish was clearly prepaired with both taste and presentation in mind. Reservations are likely a must as this kitchen is definitely on the radar of must-try for both locals and in-the-know travelers.
Everything delicious, personalized food prepared by the owner.
Amazing. Can't wait to come back
Opal is a legend. My wife and I just moved and we will forever miss your food. Thanks for the memories!

An adventure in eating at opal Thai. The owner interviews you on what you like to eat. He then creates a selection of entries for you including possibly salad, soup and main course.   You need to surrender to the experience. The food was good and different from what I usually order at other Thai restaurants. It was also pricey - almost $60 w tip.  There was not an option for a less expensive meal. Opal chooses your entries. It is not your everyday experience. Opal is a very pleasant and enthusiastic man, however we won’t be returning soon because of the cost.
Beyond amazing service! Food is just as good.
Master the art of thai food. Get the sangria and leave the rest to opal.
Quite good. Almost like being back in Thailand.
Amazing experience, Opal is the best! Who needs a menu, just trust in him!

I guess it rubs some people the wrong way that the owner gives alot of input about what you should order. Me? I never know what to order anyway. Learn to sit back and enjoy the ride imo.  The food here is amazing. Enough said.

My friend Donald, who comes to O’ahu a lot, as a cargo pilot, introduced us to this place. It blew our minds. Opal and his family treated us like special guests, choosing what to serve us based on our tastes and spice tolerance. Amazing experience and food.

Chef Opel (Thai spelling) and his staff are incredibly friendly and inviting. My wife is from northern Thailand and chef came over, made us put our phones away (hard for my wife lol) and asked us about the types of food we love to eat around Thailand and what we order when we go out. We didn’t select a thing off the menu as chef decided what he thought we would like and we loved every plate! Starting with Moo Ping! (honey pork bbq skewers) and northern Thai sausages. Then one of my favorites Khao Soi and my wife got spicy pork with chili’s basil and eggplant. The food was great, the experience was friendly and unique. This is a must stop for anyone looking for real Thai food. We will always stop by whenever we are visiting Honolulu

Got take out- for first time. I am a vegetarian so ordered veg dishes and no onions. I get home to find they gave me a chicken dish and 2/3 orders is full of onions. Called to ask for refund and owner tells me he will give me a credit next time I come- why would I go back to a place that can't even get a simple order right. The one dish that was correct was ok.
Will definitely recommend.  The chef guides you to a delicious perfect meal of what you want but also with new flavors that maybe you wouldn’t have ordered yourself.  I loved it.

Owner is extremely rude and only wants you to eat his selection. Why have a Menu? We watched him shacking hands with everybody and going on handling and bringing food to the table as well. He portrays a great amount of arrogance and we watched people next to us having an argument with him complaining about his behavior. Never again!

The place is amazing. Both the food and the service is amazing. They "took our order" that they asked and learnt our taste, what we prefer to eat, what diet we follow etc. and they just served the food based on those information. We didn't order anything per se, we got the food based on what we said we like and dislike. I love the concept and loved the food as well.

I would have to agree with the other 1star reviews. The owner tries to be friendly but really it’s just arrogance. And the fact that you have to fight to order what you want and ONLY what you want is ridiculous. Even if you lived in Thailand for years and know the exact dish you want, he still tries to act like he knows better than you. I’ve even heard unsavory stories from friends regarding his temper and how he has treated employees in the past...none of which I could verify.  But when it comes down to the food, it’s ok. If you don’t care how big your bill is and you don’t know what to order this may be the place. Otherwise  I’d recommend you drive down a little further on Nimitz to Siam Garden Cafe for more authentic food and more transparency regarding you bill.

Buyer Beware  If you've got money to blow and want someone else to order for you this is the restuarant for you. I regret not reading the reviews before heading to this restaurant, we had just gotten off our plane and we were hungry for Thai food. The owner will not allow you to order your own food, but rather plan a meal for you without giving you any price beforehand. Although, oddly enough you are presented with a menu beforehand. After 3 plates of food arrived to our table one after another we asked them to stop as we were not looking to run up a tab without knowing the price. We left annoyed and still hungry as the food was so-so and not very filling. If the owner and restuarant itself had been more upfront about the experience we could have enjoyed ourselves a little bit more. But trying to steal people's hard earned money under the guise of "this is how we do it here" is wrong and disgusting.
Great experience, AMAZING food!
Fantastic food. Who needs a menu - just go with it
Best dining experience on the island hands down. Food is incredible and diverse. If you don’t know what to order Opal will make you what he knows you want.

"If you want spring rolls go to a Chinese restaurant", said chef. But hey! you have it in your menu. Good joke! So thanks, I don't want you to mess with the things I order, I don't want to experiment and felt it was a waste of $$. After that place I went to another restaurant for my dinner.
A must visit while on holidays here from Canada. The food has so much flavour, the price is so affordable, and Opal is so much fun.
Probably best Thai I've ever had. Chef is as pleasant as can be and will custom tailor your meal. A must go.

Best Thai food I have ever had. Opal asked what flavors we liked and then served us what he thought best. The entire experience was amazing. They really care about the customers and make the dining experience fun. We wanted to go tonight but I think they are out of town:(!!!

My family visited Hawai’i during the summer and this was the one restaurant we knew we wanted to visit! We came to Opal Thai our very first night in Hawaii...did not realize we should have made reservations lol but they were Very gracious and had us seated in less than 30min. The staff was friendly and the owner was just amazing...great host! My entire family had so much fun! Food was simply delicious...hadn’t tasted anything like it before! My husband is a tough one to please with food and trust me, he was speechless! He was in awe of everything that touched his tongue lol. The owner was so sweet to my 8yr old son who was half asleep by the end of dinner. The owner went to grab a blanket and laid it on a bench and he carried my little one on the bench so he can sleep while we finish our dinner, what a gem! Can’t wait to go back again

This place is fantastic. My wife and I being very picky eaters the owner still took away our menus and spoke with us for 10 minutes about our food likes and dislikes and created a dish for us based on that. It was a way to get us out of our comfort zone while on vacation. Super nice and tasty!
Amazing food! Thank you for the experience.

Mr Opal asked your preference and customized dishes for you off the menu. We were little skeptical at the first place as we were told not to worry about the menu.  The food came out  is absolutely amazing and a pure enjoyment at reasonable price. I loved the dishes but the wife disliked the experience of not knowing what she had ordered. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking for a unique experience and good food

The owner gets upset, I mean really upset, if you don't order as he suggests. I don't care how good the food. We were frequent guests here and one time he made it sound like he is "giving" us this one dish but we later realized that he charged for it. Totally Scammed. He will "give" food you didn't even order and will charge you later. Be aware- You will get ripped off here.

Racist Thai restaurant. Attend at your own risk. Called to place an order and the guy asks me a bunch of questions like where I'm born. Then questions why I don't know the Thai name of the Thai dish that I'm asking about. Talks to me like I'm calling to prank him. Going to make make sure to add reviews on yelp and other sites too. No idea who the guy is but I wouldn't give this restaurant a single star just from that interaction.
Amazing. Completely unique experience that takes away the thinking of ordering and replaces it with a deliciously fresh experience!
A+++++ so fresh and unique dishes unlike any  other thai restaurant on oahu!
Awesome food and service. My favorite Thai food in Hawaii!!!
I traveled the world and this is the best place the best food I ever had in my life

So... He didn't tell us what we were eating? And it was amazing. If you're into that, this is for you. If not, I think there was a regular menu? Or at least I assume that's what it was. He didn't really let us look at it. Just asked us what we knew about Thai food, any dietary restrictions, and preferred spiciness, and disappeared into the kitchen. He'll surprise you with the best Thai food you've ever had.
Amazing food great service.
Great for those unsure about what to order. Chef interviews everyone and creates a special for them. For two people we had 2 appetizers and 2 mains. Left stuffed.
Best Tai food I've had, the owner is a really nice dude, I always look forward to eating here
Excellent Food!!!  Great service and hospitality!!!

They must either write their own reviews for Google or pay others to do it. You should check their reviews on Yelp. The owner is a straight up con artist. Pretends to offer you a special dining experience that he doesn't explain to you will cost you about $75 for 2 guests. He orders for you, WITHOUT informing you he's doing so in the first place. Food was good, but I actually never got what I actually ordered! We he was confronted on his scam, he acted bizarre and pretended he had done us a favor. I have never experienced any thing like this in my life. Reading the other reviews on Yelp, I learned that he does this all of the time and many others detailed almost the exact same interaction.
Wish There is an option to rate above the given 5 . Kôw soy was amazing .
The owner is AMAZING! He's extremely personable and involved in assisting you in experiencing the different dishes of the Thai cuisine!!! I love it here!!!

Really enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. Many places will serve customers but Opal goes to a great length to understand each person that comes into his restaurant, selects a menu for them and makes sure to take care of their dietary needs. The food was great! You can tell he has a passion for cooking which can be mistaken for something else as some people don't like others to choose for them. But we were not disappointed both times we went to eat here. He greets everyone and makes sure you are well taken care of. We will be back for the best Thai food I've ever had.

Wow. I am pretty picky with food and honestly haven't had a great meal every time I have visited Hawaii. I also don't usually like Thai food. The cook and all the staff were very friendly and they served us the perfect food with the right amount of spice.  Totally outdid my expectations.

This was an interesting and phenomenal experience to say the least. Interesting because the owner, Opal, personally takes all the orders and customizes the menu based on dietary preferences. Ours was quite difficult, basically vegan plus no onion or garlic. Since Opal takes the orders himself, he is very personable with everyone but also very specific in the way he works so he is tough on his staff. The food was PHENOMENAL. Loved and enjoyed every bite. If only we’d known about this place sooner in our visit, we’d probably have come every day. Hands down the best customized Thai food ever. HIGHLY recommended. But call ahead (like a week ahead) for reservations.

Opal, his wife, and team are fantastic. Best Thai food on the island! His optimistic attitude and customer service will have me coming back again and again. The lettuce wraps, papaya salad, dry curry, and chicken wings were a hit all around. Worth coming with a group and sharing the full menu!

This place is hands down the best Thai food I've ever eaten. One thing you should know before you get in, this is not you're traditional restaurant. It's like "omakase" if you know what that is. It basically means Opal chooses for you based on a few questions he will ask you.  Trust me, it's worth it. The flavors are really bold and attack every taste bud that you have. I could not put my fork/spoon/chopstick down, it was just so good.  If you're adventurous or even curious with food, I highly recommend this place. If you like to play it safe and not into flavor, I would not recommend this place.

I understand that this will sound hyperbolic, but this was one of the greatest dining experiences of my life. The chef came out to our table and interviewed us about our previous Thai food experiences and then sent out food to match. It was all phenomenal. I don't think the Thai food back home will ever live up.
Always fantastic food, and a very unique dining experience. Chef Opal and his staff are the best!

Hands down the best Thai Food I've ever had! There is a menu, but don't need to look at it. The chef will personalize your meal.  Great atmosphere and amazing food. Feel the spirit of Ohana at Opal Thai.
Amazing food, fantastic and personal customer service. Will definitely return when visiting!!
We love Opals. We go several times a month! Know before you go — Opal will create a unique dining experience for you.

Opal's was amazing! Food was so flavorful you wanted more and more. Friendly staff, and host all made you feel welcomed. Definitely recommend as a necessity to try and let them pick your food for you, trust me it was great experience.
The owners are so personable. You HAVE to come. Great food. You’ll enjoy it.
I'd fly from South Carolina just to eat here again.
Great service.  Let the owner choose your meal.  You won't regret it!

The best I have ever had. If you want an experience to remember have the owner pick food for you, after some questions he will pick some dishes that will please your senses. I have never been disappointed. Looking forward to the next time I can get there.

This place has a lot of character and charm. I come for the verbal abuse, but stay for the food which is absolute excellence. As is the service. I would be a terrible liar if I said I didn't love it. It's packed for a reason.
This place was just phenomenal! Loved the food, the staff, and the good vibes.
The food was delicious, but Opal pressured us into letting him determine what we would be served. He probably doubled our expenses!
All of the 1 star reviews are just a bunch of snowflakes. If you enjoy Asian food and don't eat here while in Honolulu, you're missing out on a great experience
Outstanding service, outstanding food, truly outstanding experience
Quirky Thai place with excellent food.  I had the Chicken Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice. Would recommend both.
Great food and service!
Intimate, fun and very friendly.  Delicious!

Owner is super friendly and you can tell he loves what he does. The special cake is absolutely amazing. Reminds me of a pork belly type of dish but it's all vegetarian. Cant go wrong with anything there. The owner definitely likes to get to know his guests and make sure you have a great time. Admittedly the taking of the menu and asking you what thai dishes you know is a bit off putting. However I ordered off the menu without issue.
Great food, very good experience, we got vegan food and it was amazing

Owner Opel was the funniest, most charming man. He wouldn’t let us look at the menu (this is a good thing) asked us a few questions and brought us the most delicious food. My whole table loved it. If I lived in Hawaii I would eat here every week. Best Thai food I have ever had. Make a reservation if you have a large party. I promise it is worth a trip to this restaurant!!

This place is phenomenal. We received 5 or 6 very flavorful dishes after speaking with the owner (who was super friendly and welcoming) the dishes served were tailored to how we answered his questions so it felt very thought out.  My only complaint is that this restaurant isn't In NYC (where I live.) I'll be looking forward to visiting again in the future.
Owner doesn't let you order and waitstaff is rude.  Food cold and not special.  Good only if you are a mindless sheep and dont know what you wanna eat.

Reservations are highly, the food is cooked to order, the owner truly love his customers and is highly engaged with their food choices. Family oriented and owned business. This was my first Thai meal and it was Truly a memorable experience,  I will return!!
Always amazing. Big up the man called Opal

Absolutely amazing, nothing like what I expected it was a wonderful experience with delicious that was nothing like anything I've had before.  So much care was put into everything that the chef and servers did.

Owner was condescending and disrespectful. We should have left immediately, but we were trying to get dinner before heading to the airport and didn’t have much time. After watching the tables around us his behavior looks like a scam to get more money out of his customers.  We chose the restaurant because it had high Google reviews and it was on the way to the airport. After being seated, the owner came by and took the menu out of my hands. He then asked us to name 5 Thai dishes, saying we couldn't name some of the more popular ones. He was aggressive and this immediately put me on edge.  He claims this is a way for him to learn your tastes so he can cook specifically for you, but if you watch the other tables everyone is getting the same dishes. Really he's just bullying you, so that you’re too insecure to order your own food. This lets him order for you and run up the bill. The tables around us that let him take over had more food in front of them than they would ever eat.  I was turned off by this behavior and ordered chicken pad thai, which he harassed me for. When it arrived, tofu was mixed in with the chicken. My pad thai and the appetizer ordered by my uncle were nothing special. This belittling style of service may work well for him in the short term, since he'll wring more money out of customers who are mostly tourists, but I can't imagine people returning.

The experience of Opal Thai is amazing thanks to Opel! He comes to each table and asks what you like, if there is anything you don't eat, how spicy you like your food and how you're doing. The food is amazing! It's the best Thai food I've had since living in Bangkok!
Chef Opal was amazing! Definitely a unique experience. Oh, and the food was an 11/10!

0 out of 5! DO NOT GO HERE! You’re not allowed to order anything off the menu. The owner is the only one allowed to take orders and he doesn’t do that. All he does is ask what you know about Thai food, and where you’re from. He’ll even ask what race you are! This guy said if you go to Thailand they’ll do the same thing. My friend spent months there, and never experienced any of this.
Great food and fantastic experience. This restaurant is how every restaurant should be run. Trust the chef/ owner - clean up your plate and enjoy the experience. Can’t wait to come back!
Don’t look at the menu! The chef himself knows what’s better for you than you do!  All of the dishes he brought us were incredible.  Such a fun experience.  Highly recommend!

Absolutely the best dining experience that I've had in Oahu. The food was excellent, and the owner was fascinating, intriguing, fun, and super entertaining. I will definitely be coming here on any future trip to Hawaii.
Great food and service.
Opal is amazing. Both the man and the restaurant. Go if you can and let him decide what you eat. Great experience.
Friendly atmosphere with amazing food. Opal knows what he's doing, just trust him
This is a must go to in Oahu. Best Thai food by a mile in Hawaii. Chef is phenomenal and makes you feel like you are in his home. Awesome!

Eating here was one of the most enjoyable culinary experiences I've had on Oahu. The chef will come to your table, ask what you like, and make the food based on your preferences. He will tailor the entire dinner around what you like and you will not be disappointed. The food is fantastic. You have to eat here!

We were surprised when we were given only one menu, then told about their specialty drinks and fresh made sangria — in a Thai restaurant. When the water was served in a metal cup, we new this experience was going to be different. The owner came over to personally meet us, asked what we knew about Thai food, asked where we were from then guessed that my son’s girlfriend was vegetarian. The Thai family is welcoming and friendly, but with a New York since of style and humor. The meal is family style but customized to each persons preferences —to some degree. But even the pickiest eater enjoyed ever bit of it. The flavors were outstanding. They even showed us how to  prepare and eat the dish. What a treat!

My entire world has been open up now to Thai food thanks to the owner and his amazing team.   They were supper hospitable and welcoming.   This place should be world famous...we highly recommend this place as your first stop here in Oahu.
This place was amazing!  This is now my favorite restaurant of any type.  This will be an intentional destination for trips to Oahu.  A meal experience!
So freaking good

Opal is a one of a kind dining experience. We consider him and his son Lio family. They do an excellent job of creating a fun, warm atmosphere at Opal. Oh, and did I mention the FOOD IS ON POINT?! Do yourself a favor and stop by...NOW!!
(Translated by Google) Nice, good food  (Original) Sympa, bonne cuisine

If you want a fun experience, this is it! There is a menu, however, you likely won't be using it. It's family style dining. The chef will get to know you, and then he will prepare a meal for you and your group. . Pretty much everything was amazing.
Food was great and amazing. The owner is very kind and friendly. I really love this restaurant and want to visit as much as I can.

I absolutely love the experience there. It’s like having a dinner at uncles family house. Everyone is close and enjoy cooking together. Yes, the owner is strict but it’s in a playful way. Once you know the Asian boss-joking way, u know what I’m talking about. He chose the dinner according to our liking and disliking 100% VEGAN. We will definitely be back!
Amazing food and outstanding customer service and atmosphere. Highly recommend this place.

One of the more unique experiences I've had at a restaurant. Trust the owner, he's not gonna steer you wrong. All the food was delicious with flavors/combinations I've never experienced. I can see how it could be difficult if you really wanted to order one particular dish.. but... if that's what you want then you'd probably be better off elsewhere. The menu just isnt designed for that. Highly highly recommend if you're in Honolulu.
Best Thai food I’ve ever had. But not just that—eating here is an all-around experience. The chef creates a surprise menu based on your taste and preferences, and it doesn’t disappoint.
This is the most amazing Thai food on the island.
The only place to eat Thai food on this island! Give it a try and you wont believe the experience. Everything from the way they take your order to the quality of the food is the best on island

The one star is not for the food. The food was quite delicious; some of the best Thai food I have ever had. The one star is because the owner/head chef is...quite honestly...volatile, short tempered, and incredibly rude. We watched him have a screaming match with one of his own employees (who was maybe only 20), continually and repeatedly degrade his female employees; speak down to them, and generally unpleasant to be around.  He was quite lovely to us, which made the switch shocking. We felt obliged to mention our disappointment to him over his treatment of his employees. Honestly, it left such a bad taste in our mouth and ruined our entire meal and experience here. If I’m spending money at your institution, I need to know that your ethics, your treatment of employees, and the vibe you cultivate is one of openness and kindness. Will not come here again.

What are unique experience. Don't worry about the men you just tell the owner what types of food you like and we'll do the rest. Sit back and enjoy the atmosphere in the crate food. It's a total environment to enjoy.

The best and most authentic Thai food you will find on Oahu! The owner will come out and talk to you to get an idea of what food you like then start bringing out plates that match that description. Great service and the owner is great to talk to! I will be frequenting here for sure.
Opal the owner is awesome! Just had his food the first time tonight.  My new favorite Thai restaurant on the Island.
Fantastic food and entertaining service. Opal (chef/owner) chats up a storm and makes sure you're taken care off. Great experience!

I went in with my friend and was seated and given menus. We both decided what we wanted. The owner comes up to us and asks us several questions about our ethnicity and what types of food we like.   We told him we wanted Pad See Ew with rice and peanut sauce. He comes back with absolutely nothing close to what we told him we wanted. He brings us chicken wings, duck salad and curry. He was super rude to his workers and embarrassed them in-front of the whole restaurant. He was taking shots with costumers and was being obnoxious. We had to send our food back twice. The couple seated next to us left because of how disrespectful he was to them. He kept petting my head and touching our hands in a very uncomfortable way. I had so much anxiety the whole time. He kept making rude and snark comments to us since we did not like what he brought us and were not finishing the dishes. There were children present in the restaurant while all this was happening. Two waitresses came up to us and apologized on behalf of his behavior with the excuse of “he’s drunk”. This is 100% not acceptable. I do not recommend to anyone. This was absolutely the worst experience I have had at a restaurant.

Seated 40 minutes after reservation and then the server (who we found out was the owner) came out to entertain us but threw our menus to the side and did not allow us to order what we wanted to eat. This "experience" was all unwarranted. He was then extremely combative when we requested to order off of the menu. It was completely unnecessary and came across as unwelcoming. I believe he is aiming for a culinary experience but it was not advertised as such and as we entered with specific desired food for dinner, we were quite annoyed that an hour and a half after our reservation we still were not allowed to order food we wanted and were served dishes blindly with no information. The food was "meh" to begin with. Oh well. Definitely not returning to support this environment and an owner that did not seem to want to work with us on creating a pleasant environment.

Overrated and expensive. Owner chooses what to order for you and prices it however he wants and charges you the amount he wants. Food is not all that great, its pretty average... Not worth it -in my opinion.. if you dont want to spend 70+ dollars for a single meal for two.. dont go here. Save your money!
Great food great atmosphere. 10/10 would do again
One of a kind experience.
Absolutely amazing Thai food and outstanding service!!!
It's really good. :)
Almost never give 5 stats but they so deserve it

Unbelievable! Very personal service. The chef is an affable meistro, the flavours we're all vivid and custom to my palate; having travelled Thailand I can confidently say this is the best and most authentic Thai on the island and I will recommend at every opportunity.

It's an unbelievable experience every time I go. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is laid back and comforting.  The owner, Opal, is one of the most pleasant men I have ever met, and will personally introduce himself to each and every customer. He'll then ask what your preferences and omissions are, if any, and your spiciness tolerance. After a few minutes you'll get the first course of a multi-course meal catered specifically to you!  EVERYTHING is delicious! The meals are not greasy at all, nor are they very heavy in the stomach. You finish your meal perfectly satisfied by the end; never left hungry and no wasted food for about $75 for two people, depending on what is served.  The wait staff are very kind and share the same familial-relationship atmosphere that Opal exudes while still displaying professionalism.  This place is nearly constantly busy and there really is little wonder as to why. It is absolutely recommended to call ahead for a reservation. There is a paid parking lot directly across the street, but it's hours vary so be aware you may have to park at one of the other paid parking lots nearby.  If it's not clear by now, I simply cannot recommend this place enough! It's certainly a must-visit while you're on the island.
Great food!

This is the best place to eat in Oahu hands down. In fact, I almost didn’t want to write a review because I don’t want it to get too popular so that it’d be hard for us to get a table. I love Thai food, but this is a new level of Thai food for me. Opal talks to everyone, in fact, he picks your food for you. The menu? Yeah, it’s only there for looks. He does ask for any dietary restrictions (I’m a vegetarian, so I appreciated this). Heads up, though-it’s not well marked. The only sign you’ll see is a neon “Opal” in the window.  Honestly, even if you don’t care for Thai food, just go for the experience of Opal alone. He’s the best part of the whole meal.
The experience alone is worth the adventure

If it only could be a 6 stars on the scale we would click on it . It’s by far the most delightful experience we had since we touchdown in hawaï . Obviously I would recommend anyone seeking for one of a kind places like this but beyond that, you will meet chef opel his wife and his staff personnally and you will for sure never forget it humanly and tastely speaking

If it only could be a 6 stars on the scale we would click on it . It’s by far the most delightful experience we had since we touchdown in hawaï . Obviously I would recommend anyone seeking for one of a kind places like this but beyond that, you will meet chef opel his wife and his staff personnally and you will for sure never forget it humanly and tastely speaking .

This place is great! I went 2 times during my short trip to Hawaii and it will be one of the most memorable aspects. Opel was amazing! I have never had so many dishes at one restaurant that I have enjoyed so thoroughly. The experience is nothing like I’ve ever had before, it’s personalized, and detail oriented and I will be making trips back to Hawaii just to visit Opal’s Thai. Top notch food, top notch service, I will never look at thai the same again
Chef came and sat down with us prior to making our meal. Very fun and personable. Food was spectacular. Reservation is recommended imo, otherwise the wait can be a while!
Hot !  Hot ! And spicey !!!

Wow! What an amazing experience!! I loved this restaurant and the food was phenomenal. The thought that was put into the various dishes was amazing and all of it complemented each other really well. I loved how personable the staff was and how they really cared for us. It was not only good food and service but a great experience, one that was really fun! Didn't know what to expect going in but I loved every minute of it!
Good place for Thai food.

Havent been there yet but heard super cool things about this restaurant as in food. All healthy all affordable. I'm going to give 5 stars because of the people I talk to about it are food and restaurant conosoures so that's my rating. Give you people more information after I get my butt over there.

Simply incredible! Could not of had a more pleasant, personable, and delicious experience. I have not tried other Thai Restaurant in the area but when I come back to Oahu I will definitely come back here! The food was delicious which gave it 4 stars but the chef's greeting service and the overall experience pushes it to 5. Be careful if you tell the chef you like it "Hot", the second hottest level, by our third dish our mouth was screaming. Bon appetit!

Opal has plenty vegan friendly options. Moreover we got there 20 min before closing and left an hour after closing time as a family member arrived to Oahu late. Everyone as usual very friendly, and Opal’s son is a gem, the kindest and most amazing young man! Incredible experience. 🌺👌🏼☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️
This really is the best Thai food I’ve had. No joke!!
This place is soooo good! The food is absolutely amazing. The experience itself is really fun. And the the family who runs it is super awesome too.
Great experience! The chef spirit is all over the place and it’s nice to be around :) Thank you Opal! Aloha

It is definitely an “Experience” everyone should experience themselves, i am not gping to spill the beans out and ruin your time. But we were still surprised how the chef know our taste and made it so perfect that we did not even leave any food behind. I wish every chef/resturant take them as an inspiration and custom everything for everything instead of labelling “this is what we do”  If you are in Oahu no matter what you love to eat, please do yourselves a favor and reseve your table at this place and enjoy the phenomenal experience.
Great food, they put on a good tasty  spread of dishes to satisfy all.

My crew went late at night and we had a wait. The place was packed, which is always a good sign. It was recommended to us by a local friend. Hands down THE BEST Thai food I have had. The family that owns the spot is A1, funny, and welcoming. Full of love and life. I will def be going back every time I'm in Honolulu.
Opal Thai is the best dine in Thai experience I've ever had. Opal is an incredible man with a great intuition for what dishes you might like.

This restaurant was like nothing I have been to before. I read some reviews before going, and it was a mixed bag. Some seemed confused as to how the ordering process worked. After being seated, guests receive a menu with the list of dishes served. The owner will come up to each table and ask A. If anyone has been there and B. The extent of ones knowledge on Thai dishes. The owner will then ask what sorts of protein and flavors the guests prefer. Food allergies and preferences will also be taken into account. The owner (Opal, I assume?) will bring you a number of dishes that fit the tables preferences. They will vary in flavor and texture. It is not a lot of food, not like typical restaurants that load up, but it is extremely filling. It is also a bit pricey, with each dish upwards of $10, but below $20. All in all, it is a fantastic restaurant, and one everybody should visit at least once in their life.  P.S. I gave it a four star review because of the price. Everything was one the pricey-er end. Definitely a “once-in-a-blue-moon” thing.
Opal's is a wonderful gem in the heart of downtown. The food is always amazing and the service is fun and personable. Highly recommended!
I have never written a review before, but my experience here made we want to write my first. The food was exceptional and the service was great. One of the best places I have eaten.
Worst service I’ve ever gotten at any restaurant.

I didn’t know dining could be like this, and boy do I love it. Chef Opal came over to talk with my mother and me, asking questions and making us laugh before going back into the kitchen and preparing us 4 surprise dishes which expanded my culinary horizons and making me smile by the sheer deliciousness of it all. The entire dinner was a mind boggling experience ad we had stumbled in by pure luck and were treated to a show and the best Thai food (possibly-food) ever.
Off the scale. Nothing else close.

Maybe the best Vietnamese restaurant we've ever been too.  So glad we found this spot while walking through Honolulu.  The summer rolls were really fresh.  Grilled pork over vermicelli was the best we've ever had.  Drunken noodles and pho soup were stellar.  Will definitely be back next time in Bean town.
Sublime
Great experience and the food is outstanding. I am just adding a little grain to this massive 5 star restaurant.

This place is an "experience" and not your average restaurant.  I wasn't quite prepared for that from the reviews I read, so I'll explain it as plainly as I can.  You will (likely) meet a playful chef and his son.  You will not order your food off a menu.  Rather, after being  asked some questions, the chef or waiter will disappear.  You will be prepared some tasty dishes that align with the things you talked about with the chef and/or waiter.  If you are on a budget, you should probably say that up front because you won't have control over what comes out of the kitchen for you.  It seems like they keep things reasonable though.  We arrived a little after 5 and did not have to wait, but they got packed shortly thereafter.  Know what you're getting into, and enjoy!

The best Ty food ever and wonderful with food allergies  Opal personally greats each group, finds out likes, dislikes and food allergies and create a wonderful meal without even writing any thing down. Every one working there does their best to ensure a wonderful food experience.
Great family owned Thai Restaurant, welcoming ambiance and amazing food!

This place is awesome! If you're not sure what you want to eat, just talk to Opal. Answer a few questions about what you like and he'll bring you amazing food. You might want reservations on weekend nights, but the wait's not bad even if you don't.

Foods and experience is amazing at opal thai.  Owner is a gem and fantastic host. I generally order pad thai, and the owner asked all of our palate tastes and what we prefer, then brought out a mix of foods. It was the best experience I have had at a thai restaurant. Would absolutely recommend highly !
I loved how interactive the owner was but we were craving certain dishes and didn't get what we wanted. The food was still quite delicious.

They used to be in Haleiwa but they relocated in Chinatown. This restaurant has a slightly different type of experience because you don't get to order off the menu. Opal, the owner, is friendly and greets all his customers. For first timers, he'll ask if you've eaten Thai food before and to name a few dishes. He'll also ask if you have any allergies, dislikes and your spice tolerance. This is his process for figuring out what dishes to bring to the table.  I recommend coming with a group of 4-6 people and factor in 1.5 to 2 hours for your meal. For regular customers, you have the option to order off the menu but when I bring my friends here, I let Opal create the whole menu. There hasn't been a dish I don't like and I always let him know in the beginning that I don't like curry. My friends still get to try a curry dish but Opal will say, "I have something else coming for you." The atmosphere in here is lively and the staff are attentive. The menu is a bit on the pricey side but the food taste delicious and the portions are decent. If you are coming with a group, you should make reservations a few days in advance. For parking, there is metered parking along Smith Street and a parking structure in Marin Tower; on the next block.
This guy is a disgrace, he rips the menu from you and insists you eat what he gives you, expensive and cash only, he was rude thinking we are ignorant in Thai food, this was the worst Thai food ever.
Amazing food. Was completely blown away.

Food was sooo good instead of a to go plate I asked for a to go truck! They should rename this place Diamond Thai. Would give your left nut for another order of their wings. My future kids are allergic to Thai food and I still ate it, millions of sperm may die..dont care. Best pineapple fried rice in da world plus mars. Thanos snapped his fingers and everyone in there was fine. Opal is the the 7th infinity stone. Place is on fiiiiiiiya.
Always a pleasure! Ohana run and they treat everyone like Ohana. The facility is super clean and the prices are awesome!  The foos is absolutely delish every time!!! Love Love Love!!

We’ve never expected such a great Thai food in Hawaii, it was literally the best. Staffs were so nice to us all the time, kind to Japanese. We were only three of us, but we could try 5 or more dishes despite our expectations were one dish for each.
So much better than the photos! Lovely people.

This Thai restaurant is upbeat and supper fresh with flavors, presentation, and style.  It isn't your typical Thai restaurant that seems to have the same repetitive format wherever you go.  What makes it really standout other then what is most important, the food, is the interaction with the staff.  From the moment you walk in, it is very friendly and attentive. There were two young hosts/servers working which by their age appearance I would guess are family members of the owner.  He obviously has trained them well with connecting with customers and giving good service with a genuine smile.  Although he didn't introduce himself as the owner/operator, a gentleman immediately approached our table and took our menus away. At first we were like a bit "WTH", but then quickly realized once he started interacting with us and talking about what we think Thai food is and the flavors we prefer, we became comfortable and allowed him to order for us.  What a great decision to put our palates in his hands.  First we were a bit concerned we would end up with food that we had no desire to eat, but quickly were in food heaven and then eventually a food coma.  Everything was tasty, fresh, and beautifully plated.  The crispy rice salad starter was something we had never had before and offered a light and refreshing beginning to more things to come.  There was also something that arrived that didn't appear on the menu that was called Special Cake on the bill that was amazing.  I think it was a fishcake that had been pan-fried and served with a sautéed bean spout melody that was just incredible. The balance of flavors and textures was perfect.  Next for the mains, we were served a chicken Kao Soy which is like a Thai Laksa and a seafood Tom Yum noodle soup.  Both were vibrant with flavors.  I like spicy and told them so, so they brought their special chili paste to add in addition to the dishes in order to get the right balance without killing the original flavors intended.  Surprisingly, we weren't given a huge bill at the end or pushed to order additional.  It was very affordable and with the quality, probably unexpectedly lower then I had intended to pay.  One grip I have is the design of the location.  At the time of day we came, the sun was still hot on the entry side of the open bay doors.  They need to install fans to keep the air moving inside if they are going to do that, but I did enjoy the openness of it.  Overall we were very happy to eat there and plan to go again. Will recommend it to everyone.

Easily the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to.  Completely authentic cuisine, great flavors, and they even made my favorite dish, Num Tok.  Incredibly friendly and helpful owner and staff.  Let them order for you, and you'll have the best damn meal you've ever had.
Probably the worst service experience ever. This happened on his Haleiwa old locatiob
This place was amazing. It's an experience. Easily the best Thai food I have ever had. Go in with an open mind and you will enjoy!!

What an experience! We had a group of 10, (rather large for this size of space) which Opal and his team did a wonderful job with our individual needs. I loved the personable feeling, attentive staff, and most of all the food! Everything was delicious.

Absolutely incredible Thai dishes! Very delicious! Opal (the masterchef) is a really cool guy, he came to our table to welcome us and our baby to his restaurant. I highly recommend experiencing Opal Thai.

Will be a main highlight of our first trip to Hawaii!  My sister has been talking about this Thai restaurant for years.  So glad we went! No menu to choose from. Pricing ended up about $30 per person for our large table (well worth the price).  Best Thai I've ever had.  Sit back, relax and enjoy!  Thank you Opel!
Absolutely amazing! Loved the food.

Absolutely the most unique experience I've ever had. They will customize your dish based on an interview of what you've had and liked in the past. The dishes we got were the BEST Thai food I've ever had. Go to Opal for a once in a lifetime dinning experience.
This was the best Thai food I ever had. Phenomenal customer service and the owner was phenomenal as well. He was very informative about the culture.

Wonderful culinary experience! The owner picks the perfect dining “program” based on our preferences. The five different dishes that arrived were excitingly fresh and creative. They even worked up a little special dish for our toddler. This meal will change the way we eat Thai in the future.
The best Thai food ever!!!!  Great atmosphere and the owner is very personable!!!
So yummy with a great atmosphere!
The food is delicious. First time visitors must let the chef select your entree. You won't regret it.

Words are not capable of accurately expressing what a marvelous experience that this restaurant offers. Easily found its way into my top 3 eating experiences ever; spanning multiple countries over decades of culinary exploration. The owner (Opal) truly defines this establishment as his own, personally treating every guest as family as he throws away the menu in front of you and begins a 5 minute chat to get to know your groups tastes on a personal level. If you are a food connoisseur and aren't a prude (cough cough the 1 star reviews) then this establishment will easily leave a lasting impression with you and anyone you bring here

The owner, staff, food & experience was phenomenal. Not your average restaurant. The owner came to our table, got to know us, and served us personally. Each dish that came to our table was beautifully crafted. Probably the top three eats I have ever had in my entire life. And #1 Thai Food period. This place is a MUST!
Lovely Authentic Thai food. The service was impeccable. Clean environs inside and outside
The chef talks to you then makes a custom meal for you!

I was really excited to try this place based on feedback from friends. Upon being seated, the owner came by and started chatting with us. He was super friendly, asked where we were from, what kind of food we like, etc. He insisted on creating special dishes for us based on our preferences and advised us not to get the typical "Thai" dishes.  We were unsure what we wanted to go with and wanted to look through the menu before deciding. At this point, the owner got verbally aggressive and snatched the menu from our hands. He said if we didn't trust him and his personalized dishes then we should just leave. This immediately ruined our mood. Despite this, we decided to stay and go with the special dishes because we wanted to taste the food everyone raved about. The moment we decided to stay was when we finally got water brought to the table...  I was quite disappointed with the dishes. Based on our preferences, I was expecting some noodle dishes and all we got were appetizers and finger foods that I never would have ordered, or would ever order. I didn't go to a Thai restaurant to eat deep fried chicken wings. If you are looking to get the typical "Thai" dishes, then I would not recommend going here. I don't even know why they have a menu if the owner gets upset if you suggest ordering from the menu.

If I could put no stars I would put no stars. This is a disgrace to the food industry. After viewing a few negative reviews, we still decided to give it a try. What a mistake that was, the reviews were accurate. Upon being seated and looking at the menu, the owner comes by starts by chatting us up, then removing our menu, he told us he would make us something special. But after viewing the other reviews we decided against it, we just wanted to order our own thing. The owner got defensive and told us to leave the restaurant, if we didn’t want to order his special menu we were told to leave. He humiliated our group in front of all the other patrons. At that point the wise thing would’ve been to leave however we bit the bullet against our better judgment and went for his special menu. What we got in the end was fried chicken wings, some fried rice and other items. Long story short, we were footed with an overly expensive bill for items we didn’t even want to eat. Had we been able to choose our own items off HIS menu, we may have actually enjoyed our experience. If your looking for Thai food, I highly advise to check out another local restaurant. We hope no one else has to go through what we went through at this joke of a restaurant. This is a fair warning to all others looking at this restaurant, be prepared to eat what ever he says. Others experience may be different, this is just our story.

I’m a lover of Thai food and have enjoyed some good Thai cuisine from several different restaurant In various states however this is some of the BEST tasting Thai food and the dining experience was just as amazing as the food .. I’m here visiting from Atlanta Georgia I’m definitely glad that I had the opportunity to dine at this establishment.
Was awesome. The best part about it is that ge chooses your food baced on your likes. Definitely going back.
Before I have only heard about places like this or seen them on Netflix. The food, the service, the everything- amazing! Thank you Opal for an amazing dinner and memories we won’t forget!
I love this place something different
Fantastic food. The best Thai I have ever eaten.

Best Thai food I've had on island, interesting experience. They give you a menu to look at but take it from you and ask about your preferences for food and what not and come out with a bunch of different dishes for you to try, all of which were excellent. Awesome staff, super friendly. Fun spot to take people who like to try new things. Quite the experience. Would definitely go back.
Awesome!!! Best Thai food ever!
Thank you ! You humble and give beautiful experience.!
Great ambiance, super staff, great food!!!
Owner gets to know his customers. When you repeat he asks what you had the last time.  Did you like it.
This place is such a unique experience. The chef is so personable. His son is very friendly. The atmosphere is so unique and everyone should try this place.
This is a one of a kind place. They used to be in Haleiwa.  Amazing original tastes built to your needs or tastes.
Awesome Experience!

The chef comes and welcomes you, gives you a "you are special" feeling. He talks to you to find out what you like or dislike, and prepares a special dish according to your likes. Great food great experience

(Translated by Google) It was a very fresh Thai experience at Senia's doorstep, and it was a fresh experience! At first I tried to order it with the menu plate, but the owner came in person and got chicken, prawns, food that he can not eat in the crab. I eat spicy food well. I asked him if he was vegetarian and he gave me food with course. I could be embarrassed at first. Yes. I also have high fives in a couple of times. Of course, the food is awesome. I also bought two appetizers and two main dishes. It would be nice if you could go one time! Amazing experience!!! My partner and I came to Opal Thai after hearing it is the best Thai in Honolulu and it did not disappoint. What makes it so unique is each diner gets to interact directly with Opal. Forget a standard menu! His passion and his culinary creativity lead to unique multi-course meal for each table that takes into account your specific dietary preferences, Thai food experience, and more. (We are Indian and vegetarian but we eat egg whites. He incorporated these details into our meals!) Opal and his staff offer make you feel like a family member with their hospitality. Despite the hustle everyone is attentive, but not in an invasive way. This is easily a top-three experience for our whole trip to Hawaii. We will absolutely be back.
We went for lunch and the food was great. Great service and the owner/chef hand pick our whole meal (appetizers, main entree, drinks)

This restaurant is the best I have experienced here in Hawaii. The chef/owner comes to your table, asks your food likes and dislikes, your spice tolerance then prepares your dinner. He brings what he believes you like. He was right on for my daughter and I. We loved everything he sent to the table. Well worth the wait to get seated if you don't make reservations. A must try in Chinatown, Honolulu.

Unique restaurant. The owner spent a lot of time with our table and ensuring we had the best food (he asked us what we did/didn’t eat and then brought us food - we didn’t order). The two young kids in our group enjoyed a lot of the plates, too. This was quite the dining experience and one of the best meals I’ve ever eaten!

Unique dining experience and food. The chef comes to your table and interviews you about Thai food,  then goes and makes things and brings them to you. So the food is a surprise. Some things I liked some things I really liked and a couple I didn't.  Great place to go with a group.
This is a must if visiting on the North Shore.

This was the most delicious Thai food I've ever eaten! The chef asked about our Thai food preferences were, instead of ordering off the menu, and then delivered a four course meal. It started with a brilliant palate opener, lardi? (Spelling), shown below. There was a mystery dish that may have been fish with spouts, with an amazing texture. Then we had soup, similar to lemon grass broth but with peanut satay sauce in it. It was divine. Then, we had the most amazing garlic, friend basil leaves, yum, eggplant and green beans. The little bitesize eggplant interior melted in my mouth, while the outside was still soft. The sear on the green beans was perfect, the basil leaves were crunchy. The flavor was out of this world on all of these dishes. The chef's son was really nice. We sat at the bar. The waitress made sure I knew how to eat the dishes. I will be back!!!! Thank you, Opal Thai.
Fantastic atmosphere ....food and service!  A must to go in Honolulu ....you won’t be disappointed.
Wonderful small Thai bistro on north Shore of Oahu. Opal himself will probably coordinate  your food choices so to give u a meaningful experience.
Best dining experience I have had, maybe ever. 10/10 would recommend.

Be warned. He will order for you and it will cost way more than you expect. Some of the stuff you might like some of the stuff you may not. But it will all be overpriced. The guy should at least ask your budget before you ordering stuff for you.  And pretty much everyone in the restaurant gets the same stuff. In other words he's pushing stuff that he has rather than stuff that you will like. He acts like it's tailored to you but it's not.
Hands down the best Thai food and atmosphere I have experienced! The owner really makes this place phenomenal.
Closed on a Thursday and not BYOB anymore.

Amazing food, amazing atmosphere and the best staff ever. The owners (Opal, Aoy and Son ) and staff treated us like family. All the food was so flavorful and fresh, it exceeded my expectations. Don’t bother looking at the menu, ask for recommendations and you’ll be blown away. They are so generous and you can see how much they love what they do.

Don't go here if you are a picky eater who needs changes to menu items. If you want a fun and interesting eating experience, and are willing to allow the chef to make you a meal based on a conversation he has with you, this is the place for you!
Amazing

INCREDIBLE FOOD AND UNBEATABLE SERVICE!  Truly a MUST try if you live on island or you're just visiting.  Absolutely floored by how great the experience was!  BYOB incase you want to have a drink with your meals.

Wonderful, fresh Thai food.  Opal serves food based on your talk with him.  Trust him and he'll serve you a feast.

Amazing and unique dining experience! Chef Opal (aka Thai Mr. Miyagi) is an outstanding man passionately pleasing hungry guests with tastes and enough positivity for all! Truly one of the best meals ever, thanks Chef Opal!
