Excellent experience. The chef made an excellent custom menu and was actively engaged in the meal in a very quaint hole-in-the-wall restaurant.
Excellent Thai food with impeccable service. Opal is a legend! Highly recommend!

Opal provides a unique twist in any other dining experience. The seating area is small, which allows Opal to fly around and meet with each guest. He will ask if you know what you want on his menu. If you ask his recommendation, he'll fire off a few questions and nail a perfect recommendation.  For the truly adventures diner, just ask Opal to surprise you.  You will be rewarded with a fantastic, flavorful feast unlike anything you've experienced.
Amazing service with best thai food on the island

Favorite Thai Restaurant! Being a frequent visitor to Oahu, I make this a must-do every trip. Some good advice, DITCH THE MENU, and be open to whatever Opal suggests. You need to make an event out of it, and set aside time to go. I have never had something I didn't like, and their new location is awesome!

So the owner told me if he was at my house and I cooked for him that he would eat all the food I made for him...when I said the smell from the food didn't agree with me and apologized that I didn't eat it....oh did I mention I didn't even order that food he just brought it and a couple other things and made me pay for food I didn't want...
We had Opal choose our meals and they were marvelous.  Service was terrific also!

We made reservations for 7:30 pm; confirmed that there will be four of us. Arrived at the restaurant precisely on time. We were told that there would be a 45 min wait. Thirty min later we were told the same thing. The restaurant had at least 16 people waiting, they seem to have double or triple-booked. According to friends the food is great but really they should be in the food truck or take-out business, not the proper sit-down restaurant. Ruined our evening - you should avoid.
The owner Opal and his team makes the best Thai food and will challenge you to try new things. I'd give it 6 stars if it was possible

The best Thai food I've ever had. PERIOD.  Don't read into the few negative reviews.  They are from lame control freaks.  It's a different experience than you might be used to, as the owner orders for you.  LET HIM DO HIS THING.  He asks you what you like, and if you are allergic to anything, and then GOES FOR IT.  Great guy, passionate, and THE FOOD IS RIDICULOUS!  Get a reservation EARLY, as in 5pm, and then let it all play out.  I'd give this place 10 stars if GOOGLE would let me.

(Translated by Google) My most favorite Thai food restaurant 😊 were happy they moved to downtown! My favorite Thai restaurant in Hawaii. Whatever you eat is delicious.  (Original) My most favorite Thai food restaurant😊 were happy they moved to downtown! ハワイで一番好きなタイ料理の店。何を食べても美味しいです。

The owner and son are super friendly and nice to kids.  Especially, the owner show our kids how to eat Thai food in right way.  The owner decides the dialed for us.  You have to open mind and trust him.  Over all everything are good and we are all happy customer.  For sure we will come back again.
Best Thai place in Oahu. Excellent chef and great customer service. Every time we visit the island we make it a point to dine in few times here.
The waitress was a little bit rude, it took so long for the food, order and even pay, but the food is amazing, delicious. The Owner is really friendly

One of the worst food I have ever touched in my life. Chef/owner is rude people. I am still wondering why the menu cards were printed if he is bringing his own dishes irrespective of the customer order. Strongly recommending not to visit.
Best dining experience I've ever had

Chef Opel nailed it! We were taken by surprise when he took our menus and asked us questions about food and preferences. We let him take the wheel and he took great care of us! Such a wonderful, unique experience.  Unlike any other!  Mahalo!
Favorite Thai Food on the Island! Highly Recommend
Simply fantastic!  The chef/owner created a dinner specifically for us!! Absolutely delicious. Great off the beat and path restaurant.

Opal took my menu away, asked me some questions about what kind of Thai food I like and how hungry I was. Very hungry, I said. They brought me two dishes, both bursting with flavor! I walked in very hungry and walked out very happy :)
Excellent customer service and the “special” dish is amazing
Opal and his crew is amazing! The best Thai we’ve eaten in a very long time. A must for thai lovers in Oahu.

The decor and space can be deceiving but the attentive service makes up for it. Opal coming to your table, chatting with you to determine what you’ll  like and whipping up secret dishes is the whole experience!

As former employee and customer have to say they are the best,  miss them all so much.  A have to, must see, so delicious,  and they have the biggest hearts.  They are really truly the best!!! Can't wait to be on Oahu again.
Best Thai food my wife and I have ever had . Going back tonight.!
Best place ever in Haleiwa; I'm excited to try the new location in Chinatown!
Absolutely worth finding and experiencing! The food and service were awesome!

Really sucks writing this because we were hoping for the best. Instead we had an hour wait, a dramatic scene between the owner and one of his staff, some awkward conversations with our servers and some thai food that was good but not very thrilling. This restaurant is not conventional nor is the owners personal business demeanor. If you want to be seated in the order you arrive, order what you want from the menu, be able to budget your purchase, this is NOT for you. If your happy to be ordered for without any prices being told to you after you've waited for a table without being told how long you'd be standing there then give it go. Many people seem to have enjoyed their experience. I wish we did. We will not return to this business.

One of the best Thai experiences we have had.  We went here on the recommendation of a friend and found the service to be fantastic.  It wasn't too busy, so the owner came out to chat with us and created a custom menu based on what we liked.  Every dish was very delicious.  He then recommended a few restaurants from where we were from on the mainland, tried one of them so far and it was also delicious.  The one thing to prepare for is that this place is cash only.

Best culinary experience! Eating there is a whole experiment itself. You gotta try it to know about it and enjoy the North Shore at its finest. Opal knows how to surprise you and you'll have a wonderful time! Opal and his son are lovely people:) thanks for the Thai food experience!

Hands down the most amazing meal I've ever eaten. There was a very long wait (more than an hour) so I recommend a reservation. Opal shook all of our hands and introduced himself. He's an interesting and friendly guy. And absolutely knows what he is doing. He asked us flavors we like and our dietary restrictions (we were dining with a vegan who likes very spicy food). You can bring your own booze (bought from the pharmacy next door). It is family-style where you eat eat a little bit of everything and not one individual dish. It was pricey but were a party of 5. We left stuffed in a good way.
Really nice restaurant! Totally different experience to make order:) very responsible and friendly owner. The food was really fantastic!!!
Good food good service!
Best Thai food outside of Bangkok! Every dish is beyond delicious with an amazing combination of flavors. Opal truly knows how to pick the right dish for you! Ono!

First at all, if there is a choice for ZERO stars, I will select zero stars. On 8/15/17, My friend and I went this place to have lunch. What a mistake we made! There were 3 - 4 tables were empty when we were seated.  About 20 minutes later, there was no one brought manual nor took order from us.  When we asked a waiter the Asian man with a beard to bring some water, surprisingly, he answered that he will bring water to us after he takes order from us and we have to wait. A few minutes later after another waitress brought water to us, this waiter came to our table and asked what are our races.  After we refused to tell him, he told us to get out of the restaurant. OMG. I have not encountered anything like this in my life. I couldn't wait for another second to leave this that place, who knows our food might serve with some nasty flavor if we stayed. To that waiter, you deserved to be fired, if you are the owner, shame on you.  I will recommend everyone NOT to go to this restaurant.

Don't trust the posted business hours. We made the trek to North Shore from downtown and arrived to a closed restaurant at 12:30 PM. We found out from a nearby store that the owner opens when he feels like it. Maybe try calling ahead before coming here to make sure it's open.
I don't like thai food. This place is authentic and absolutely incredible.

THIS IS NOT YOUR TYPICAL RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE. If you like making choices and ordering people around do not come here. You come, (probably wait), sit, tell the owner what flavors you like and what you don't, and he brings you delicious food. Easy! He charges one price for everyone (very reasonable for how much you get) and BYOB. There is a Longs Drugs across the way you can pick up beer, wine, whatever. Lastly, CASH ONLY. Be ready for the ride of your life and have fun!

(Translated by Google) Manager is very friendly. When I was thinking of choosing from the menu, it was all up to me. It was a garlic kit, but it tasted so good. It is a little different from authentic Thai food, but this is ant.  (Original) マネージャーがとてもフレンドリー。メニューから選ぼうと思っていたら、全てお任せで作ってくれました。にんにくキツめでしたが、ガツンとくる味で美味しかったです。本場のタイ料理とは若干違いますが、これはこれでアリです。
Best Thai food I've ever had!
Great food, great service!

Don't believe the hype.  The food is just OK, certainly nothing to go out of your way for.  Better Thai is available at either Rajanee or the Thai truck just down the street.  The problem with Opal is, well, Opal himself.  Rude and arrogant, he insists you know nothing about Thai food and will not actually allow you to order what you want.  He tells you what you want. The menu is a farce to make you think has a selection of food, when in reality he has a few select things that he forces you to eat. He puts on a show, pretending like he will make something special for you, and then brings whatever he has on hand is trying to get rid of.  Everybody who walks in gets the same three dishes of his choosing, like it or not.  As a result your Thai dinner for two that would be no more than $30 turns into a $60 bait and switch scam. The location is very cramped, no AC and no bathroom.  Overall a very uncomfortable and truley unpleasant experience.  While this might be described as "unique" by those who consider "eating out" to be going to McDonald's or Golden Corral, avoid Opals at all cost if you appreciate a nice dining experince and your dignity.  You will leave Opals with neither.

amazing food geniune owner. he does the ordering for you by asking questions about what u like or dislike. If u dont like something speak up. table next to us listed off a few things they did not like and those iyems were not in their food. HOWEVER if you want something specific, this is not the place. this is only when you want good food and an experience of something new.
What a great experience and excellent food.

If you're looking for amazingly delicious Thai food on the North Shore look no further then Opal Thai! The staff if great and I had the pleasure of meeting the Owner/Chef which was an absolute pleasure; he was even nice enough order for me and I was blown away, the drunken shrimp was perfection! Thanks Opal Thai, my new go-to for a delicious Thai meal on the North Shore!

This was the most unique dining out experience I have ever had. The owner took our order himself. He never showed us a menu. Instead, he got to know us with a few questions about our food preferences and where we are from. Then he just magically whipped up the perfect dish for us. It was delicious!
He kicked us out due to our race
Super friendly staff. Owner was very outgoing and made sure we had a great time. Amazing food. This was a great eating experience.

Excellent food. Restaurant is not for closed-minded person. The owner, Opal, will come to your table and asks numerous questions to determine what he wants to make for you. Again, this is not an "order from the menu" establishment. Let Opal do his magic and you will not be disappointed.

The food was awesome!!  We are from Seattle area and have eaten lots of good Thai food so are experienced eaters.  The owner was sooo nice.  He does love to shake hands and did fist bump our girls.  He did take our menus away, but we loved everything they brought out to us.  He took into account that I like spicy and our girls do not.  He brought out two larb dishes, one spicy and one not.  Everything he brought us, we loved.  Between 4 of us, we had the two appetizers(Larb), crispy garlic chicken, a dish with wide noodles like pad-see-ew, but not the same, a pineapple curry, sauteed green beans, another dish that he would not say what it was, but it looked like some tofu cakes with bean sprouts (it tasted awsome) and one thai iced coffee.  All this food still only came to $81.  I don't feel we got taken or that he was trying to "run up the bill" as other poster have suggested.  All the food was great, some of the best we had and the experience of someone choosing food for you was a welcomed change.  This gave us the opportunity to eat differently than what we would have ordered ourselves.  All this being said, if you are not adventurous at all and only want the "typical" american Thai fare, you probably won't like it.  However, if you want a fun experience and great food, you should try it.  We found out they do take reservations, so that would be a good idea.  We did not have reservations and had to wait about an hour.  They took my cell number so we walked around the town and other shops until they called which was perfect.  The owner and all the staff were excellent.  Food and service was 5 star.
This place is so full of love it over flow into the food💖
Easily the best Thai food I have had in my life. The service is timely and familial. I cannot recommend this place too much! It's a "must" on the island.
Absolutely the best Thai everrrr!
Excellent service and food!!!
The food is just amazing!!

Waited 20 mins for a table, then waited 20 mins at a table before served. Extremely confused. Totally made sense and loved the reason why: the owner customizes your order for you and doesn't tell you what you're getting. If you're a not an adventurous eater then order takeout, but for a date night you'll talk about for a while make a reservation and enjoy the time. My wife and I were so thankful we stumbled upon this place on google maps.

Best Thai food I have ever had. And the service is amazing! BYOB and they will give you a bucket of ice to keep your drinks cold throughout the meal. It takes a while to get a table and order, but that is because the owner comes to every single table to get to know you and set up a menu for you. He asked us if we could name 6 Thai dishes (we got 3) and then asked us about seasonings and meats that we liked. He asked about food allergies and heat preference as well. After that the food came out quickly in 5 courses that we all shared. Every single dish was amazingly flavorful. It is cash only but there is an ATM in the same building. Cannot wait to go back!
